Applications are being &C
cepted from present or former
federal employees who have cur
rent Civil Service reinstatement
eligibility for:


Janitor, W.. $l.9 to $2.l9
per Hour applicants musthave
Veteran preference)


Laborer, VS., S2.08 to $3.50
per hour


Qualified persons should mail
or bring a completed Standard
Form 81, Application for federal
employment to:


Civilian Pers onnel Office


Building l64


Luke Air Force Base, Arizona

Lightweight, non-woven inter-
facings made of 100 per cent
Dacron are particularly suited for
garments made of wash-and-wear
fabrics.


In addition to regular" inter-
facings for normal sewing, there
are all-bias stretch versions to go
with stretch fabrics and garment
stress areas - and iron-on inter-
facings designed for edge tapes,
hens, and Wristbands. All are as
washable as the fabrics they
reinforce.

iodicals as Ladies' Home Jour-
nal, Health, Woman's Day and
the Lincoln Herald.


A collector Of old books and
pamphlets in the field Of Amer
icana, and an active member Of
various historical societies,
Mrs. Dannett Is Director of the
Civil War Round Table of New
York and was selected for the
nine-woman Civil War National
Centennial Committee. She is
married to Emmanuel Dannett,
prominent New York attorney.


Noel N. Marder, president of
Educational Heritage. the York
ers, New York publishing firm
which is producing "Negro Herr
tage Library at cost Of more
than 1000. 900. said he believes
"Profiles Of Negro Women" will
be regarded as the greatest single
repository on Negro Women and
their contributions to the pro-
gress of the Negro in America.


The first volume covers the
period from 1919. when Negroes
arrived in the United States and
Canada, to mid-20th century,
ending with the outstanding
achievements of such women as
DR.. Mary Mcleod Bethune and
Mary Church Terrell.

Negro Women To Be Featured
In New Sc Series

NEW YORK A two-volume
set "Profiles Of Negro Women"
highlighting the contribution of
Negro women to culture and pro-
gress of America, is a part of
the forthcoming Negro Heritage
Library.


Written by Sylvia G. L. Dan
nett, Civil War historian and
author. the completed work will
provide comprehensive and doc
umented accounts of the strate-
gic role Negro women played
during difficult days Of slavery
and Reconstruction. This first
volume will be published with
seven other volumes in late sum-
mer. The initial volume is died.
icated to Mrs. James Weldon
Johns on.


A graduate of Douglass Col
lege in New Jersey, Mrs. Dan
nett has worked as a freelance
advertising and publicity copy
writer. She is co-author of Defy
the Tempest" and "Down Mem
DRY Lane" and is editor and COM
piler of "Noble Women of the
North"


In addition, Mrs. Dannett is
author of "a Treasury Of Civil
War Humor" and Of the biography
"She Rode with the Generals"
She has contributed to such per-

Miss Georgia and Harvey Lindsey we're married at
pm Sunday Phillips Memorial Church. Rev. L. j. Harper
oiciaed.


Mr. and Mrs. George F. Mathews 1918
Sherman. bridegroom is the Of Mrs. j. D. Holiness
10Th ST.. and Harvey Lindsey Sr. OF Los Angeles


Mathews maid of honor and Miss Alice Holmes
bridesmaid.


Attending bridegroom Leonard CALDWELL best man. and
Gerald Jones' Hartley Bob Corners Leon Long Willie Bos-
we'll, ushers


After the ceremony reception was held in the church.


Phoenix The bride is nurse at Coca
Hospital and the bridegroom is student at Arizona State
University where he is ma joring in education.
